text: firefox (96.0) goes into an infinite redirect loop when adding/removing modules from page :thinking_face:

UPDATE: Sorry, this is my fault, there were multiple theme-override.css being used on the site and I edited the wrong one. It's working now. >_<

Hi! Sorry, im editing a theme-override.css file and I see that it becomes theme-overrides.min.css file on the live pages. Is there a way to prevent the minification step? because I noticed i'm not seeing the changes i made to file (it's not being reflected to the min file). >_<
you should install the HubSpot developer extension on your browser to bust HubSpot cache easily

I actually already tried that but it's not working for me. I'm editing the theme-override.css from the design manager, and i've published the changes, but i'm not seeing those css I added in the theme-overrides.min.css :disappointed:
have you tried adding ?hsDebug=True to your url?
I was editing the wrong theme-override.css
im so sorry for wasting your time :disappointed:
Haha no problem I’ve been there many a time!

Maybe related new in 96

Firefox will now enforce the `Cookie Policy: Same-Site=lax` by default which helps defend against Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks.
Is there a way to customize knowledge base? Even a workaround to include an external css?
